page.title: 08Butleigh Monument
page.content: Butleigh monument towers above the treeline in a clearing in the woods about 30 feet above the road which passes over the ridge dissecting the vale. Above the road a steep wooded bank leads up to an opening in the wood. Butleigh monument towers about 150 feet into the air a tall, thin column, which supports the celebrated statue of{Sir Samuel Hood.}It dominates the whole of the surrounding area with its size. It was set up to commemorate the thoroughly eventful and important life of Sir Samuel Hood, a high_ranking officer of His Majesty's fleet, who lived locally.His contributions politically and militarially were vast, without which England would not have held such a commanding naval position in his time. He died at Madras on the 24 December 1814.The monument honours a great man.
